title: How a stuck office drawer helped uncover the story of Amelia
description: An order of service for Amelia Roberts' funeral found in a drawer led to a tweet which went viral.

title: Ukraine coat of arms in UK anti-terror list furore
description: The Ukrainian embassy demands "official apologies" over a UK police counter-extremism guide.

title: A bit of... hopeful news? Fry and Laurie discuss reunion 'often'
description: Hugh Laurie says he and Stephen Fry have missed a deadline they set themselves to reunite.

title: 'Being segregated as a youth offender made me want to hurt people'
description: Sephton Henry says separating youth offenders from their peers leaves them "in a place of distress".

title: Schools warned against 'gaming' exam league tables
description: Ofsted says schools must not inflate results with low-value qualifications.

title: 23,000 apply for two summer jobs on remote Irish island
description: The two successful candidates will live together without electricity and hot water for six months.

title: Konta & Edmund out but Dart wins final-set tie-break to advance
description: Johanna Konta and Kyle Edmund are among four Britons to lose on day two of the Australian Open but Harriet Dart advances with a thrilling win.

title: Davos: Trump decries climate 'prophets of doom' at World Economic Forum
description: The US leader attacks environmentalists at the World Economic Forum, which Greta Thunberg is attending.

title: Harry and Meghan: Prince arrives in Canada ahead of new chapter
description: He lands in Vancouver to be reunited with his wife as they prepare for a life away from royal duties.

title: Emiliano Sala felt 'forced out' by Nantes before plane crash
description: The footballer sent a message days before he died saying he did not feel valued by FC Nantes.

title: Network Rail probe over Northern and TransPennine routes
description: The rail regulator says Network Rail's performance was not good enough in the north and central England.

title: Woman gang raped in Plymouth in 1978 wants attackers to face justice
description: Jane was 17 when she was attacked by "drunk and brutal" men who said they were part of a rugby team.

title: NHS faces huge clinical negligence legal fees bill
description: Doctors' groups say the current system is not fit for purpose and requires "fundamental" reform.

title: New UK housing 'dominated by roads'
description: Roads are dominating new housing developments, a report says, despite more people wanting to drive less.

title: Van Gogh self-portrait is genuine, experts decide
description: A portrait that has puzzled art experts for decades is finally declared a real Van Gogh.

title: New China virus: Warning against cover-up as number of cases jump
description: Beijing's top leaders urge transparency as it is confirmed the coronavirus can pass between people.

title: Prince Harry and Meghan: Black British women on Meghan
description: As Meghan and Harry start their new lives in Canada, do people think race is an issue in the way she is treated?

title: What high fashion is doing about cultural appropriation
description: Commes Des Garçons became the latest fashion house to cause offence at Paris Fashion Week on Friday.

title: Pyjamas in public: Chinese city apologises for 'shaming' residents
description: The local authority said it was trying to promote "civilised" behaviour - but later apologised.

title: Photographic artists reflect the past, present and future
description: At this year's London Art Fair, Occupy the Void showcases 10 female photographers aged over 50.

title: Man Utd charged by FA for confronting referee at Liverpool
description: Manchester United are charged by the FA for failing "to ensure its players conducted themselves in an orderly fashion" during Sunday's defeat at Liverpool.

title: New solar power source and storage developed
description: Tie-up of flexible solar film and energy storage aims to take homes and business off-grid.

title: New MOTDx signing Timbsy talks boots & trains with Arsenal at Predator launch
description: New signing Michael Timbs makes his MOTDx debut talking boots at the Adidas Predator launch with Man City’s Ilkay Gundogan and Aymeric Laporte and gets to try the new boots out at Arsenal.

title: Memphis Grizzlies duo Ja Morant & Jaren Jackson Jr lead NBA plays of the week
description: Watch NBA plays of the week, including an impressive team move by Memphis Grizzlies duo Ja Morant and Jaren Jackson Jr in their victory over the Houston Rockets.

title: Being born with no smell: 'I don't know what food tastes like'
description: Only around 5% of the population suffer from a smell disorder, but it doesn't just affect your nose.

title: Windrush scandal: 'A billion pounds can't buy back my happiness'
description: Chiplyn Burton was denied entry back into the UK after a trip to Jamaica in the 1970s.

title: Kylian Mbappe: PSG & France star on teenage success, and Liverpool being a 'machine'
description: Paris St-Germain striker and World Cup winner Kylian Mbappe talks to Natalie Pirks about becoming a football superstar, Liverpool's title charge and his future.

title: Newspaper headlines: Harry 'flies to Canada' and Lord Hall steps down
description: Tuesday's front pages carry a mix of stories, including on the royals and the BBC's director general.

title: Men make 'Earth sandwich', nearly 12,500 miles apart
description: To make an Earth sandwich, you need two people at precise points on opposite sides of the globe.

title: Brexit: What is a level playing field?
description: What are people talking about when they refer to a level playing field and what has it to do with Brexit?

title: 'You are never far from a sausage roll'
description: People who have a healthy weight are in the minority in Scotland. Why is that and what can be done?

title: How Nigeria's cricket team 'shocked the world'
description: Nigeria's Under-19 side are World Cup debutants but cricket remains a minority sport at home.

title: The Solway Firth haaf netters fighting to save a fishing tradition
description: Fishermen on the Solway Firth say the Viking-era practice of haaf netting could die out within a generation.

title: How a boy from Vietnam became a slave on a UK cannabis farm
description: Ba was a street child in Ho Chi Minh city. He ended up growing cannabis as a slave in the UK - until he escaped.

title: Trump impeachment trial: Five possible twists ahead
description: Many believe President Trump will be acquitted in the end. But could it yet diverge from the script?

title: Windrush: Reunited over 70 years later
description: The BBC has brought together two men in their nineties who came to Britain from Jamaica in 1948 on the Empire Windrush.

title: Paternity leave: Why Japan is talking about Shinjiro Koizumi
description: This politician is going on leave to take care of his newborn son, and it's pretty controversial.

title: Portishead's Hedgehog Lady on the hunt for volunteers
description: Beryl Casey has been rescuing hedgehogs for 25 years and wants someone to carry on as she gets older.

title: Emiliano Sala: A year on from plane crash, his family speak of 'pain that will never go away'
description: One year has passed since Emiliano Sala's death in a plane crash. His family in the small rural town of Progreso, Argentina, are still suffering.

title: Robot tanks: On patrol but not allowed to shoot
description: Sophisticated unmanned mini-tanks patrol alongside soldiers, but humans still decide when to shoot.
